intro: Sericocarpus oregonensis var. californicus, commonly known as the California lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its small, hairy leaves and clusters of blue or purple flowers. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid conditions. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and botanical studies.
